column2: FLORIDA PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. If it is your second collision in a 2-year period, you will be required to:
column8: attend a Community Centre for 3 months.
column10: attend a Traffic Collision Avoidance Course.

column2: 2. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
3. Anyone who uses a Parking Permit that does not belong to them can:
column4: be charged with a second degree misdemeanor.
column6: loan the Parking Permit to people with disabilities.
column8: legally park in spaces reserved for people with disabilities.

column2: 4. You can be charged with DUI if you are found to be driving:
column4: while under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.
column6: under the influence of heavy metal music (rage music).

column2: 5. Drivers must obey traffic signals except when:
column10: a car is at the stop line.

column2: 6. Which drugs can affect a person’s ability to drive safely?
column6: Many prescription drugs and even many of the drugs you can buy without a prescription.

column2: 7. Unless otherwise posted, what is the speed limit on a highway outside a town or city?
8. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
9. Drinking alcohol does NOT:
10. Which of the following is true about double yellow lines, one solid, one broken?
column4: They prohibit vehicles moving in either direction from crossing the lines.
column6: If the broken line is closer to the driver, he/she can cross the broken line only to pass another vehicle, if it is safe to do so.
column8: They separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 11. Your license can be cancelled if:
column4: your license was issued in error.
column6: you are found guilty of 2 cases of reckless driving within one year.
column8: you are found guilty of racing on a highway.
column10: you break a traffic law and fail to pay your fine.

column2: 12. What is the meaning of fluorescent yellow green signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 13. Bike lanes are separated from motor vehicle travel lanes by:
14. The Financial Responsibility Law requires you to have bodily injury liability insurance at the time of:
column4: a crash where you are at fault and injuries have occurred.
column6: a citation for DUI, which results in a revocation.
column8: a suspension for excessive points against your driver license.

column2: 15. Motorcyclists may slow down without visual warning because:
column4: they take up less of your field of vision.
column6: they can stop much more quickly than cars.
column8: they often slow down by downshifting or rolling off the throttle.
column10: some motorcycles may not have the brake light.

column2: 16. A _______ line marks the left edge of the pavement on divided or one-way roadways.
17. Drivers should ________ share the lane with a motorcycle.
18. The driver in the picture is using hand signals to show that he is about to:
19. Vehicles going less than __ miles per hour must display the ‘slow moving vehicle’ sign on the rear when using public highways.
20. At the time of arrest for DUI, you will be suspended if you have a breath or blood alcohol level of ___ or above.
21. Drivers under 21 years old who receive a notice of suspension for driving with a BAL of .02 to .05, must:
column6: complete an advanced driver improvement course.
column8: complete a Traffic Law and Substance Abuse Education course.
column10: complete a basic driver improvement course.

column2: 22. Which of the following is NOT dangerous:
column4: Driving while texting on a mobile phone.
column8: Using high-beam headlights within 100 feet of oncoming vehicles.
column10: None of the other answers are correct.

column2: 23. Horizontal rectangles:
column8: are used exclusively for yield signs.

column2: 24. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
25. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 26. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 27. Who has the right-of-way in Florida?

28. You are driving toward a railroad crossing that does not have gates or lights. A train is approaching, but there might be just enough time for you to cross the tracks before it arrives. You should:
column4: stop on the tracks and get out of the vehicle immediately.
column6: increase your speed and cross the tracks before the train arrives.
column8: slow down, stop at the crossing, and wait for the train to cross in front of you.
column10: cross the tracks only if the train is more than 50 feet away.

column2: 29. What should you do if you drive past the exit on an interstate highway where you wanted to get off?
column6: Slow down and signal the intention to leave the expressway by using the turn signal.
column10: Make a U-turn and go back to the desired exit.

column2: 30. The ‘Speeding Fines Doubled’ sign applies to:
column6: expressway exit ramps and divided highways.
column8: both active school and work zones.

column2: 31. If a road has four or more lanes with two-way traffic, drivers should drive _______ except when overtaking and passing.
32. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 33. Which of the following are NOT exempt from the seat belt requirements?
column6: Buses used for transportation of persons for compensation.
column10: A person certified by a physician as having a medical condition that causes seat belt use to be inappropriate.

column2: 34. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 35. If you are driving on a two-lane road and come to an intersection with a divided highway, you:
column4: must yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to other traffic.

column2: 36. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 37. Reckless driving will result in __ points being added.
38. What is the stopping distance of an average freight train traveling at 30 MPH?
39. Drivers may not have on or in their car:
column6: Signs, stickers or posters on windows, except those required by law.
column8: A TV which the driver can see.

column2: 40. All children _____ years of age or younger must use a restraint device when riding in a motor vehicle.
41. Any driver under the age of 18 who accumulates _ or more points within a __ month period is automatically restricted for one year to driving for “Business Purposes ONLY”.
42. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 43. Cars must have two red stoplights, visible from ___ feet in the daytime.
44. When leaving an expressway, drivers should NOT:
column4: slow down as soon as they are off the expressway.
column6: signal their intention to leave the expressway by using their turn signal.
column8: make last-minute turns into an exit.

column2: 45. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column10: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 46. You are going to a party where you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: be extremely careful when driving back home.
column6: arrange to go with two or more persons and agree which one of you will not drink alcohol.
column8: stop drinking at least half an hour before leaving the party.
column10: drink no more than 4 glasses of wine.

column2: 47. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 48. What are three types of intersections on the road?
49. The average driver has a reaction time of:

50. A licensed driver (Class E or higher) who is under the age of 17 years of age may not operate a motor vehicle between ___________, unless accompanied by a driver who is 21 years of age or older and holds a valid driver license (Class E or higher)
